name: AI Golf Swing Coaching and Handicap Reduction Automation
description: Automates digital golf-swing analysis, personalized practice-plan generation, progress tracking, and coach-assisted review to reduce a player's handicap. The agentic system ingests user-submitted swing videos and optional sensor/club data, runs pose estimation and swing-metric extraction (clubhead speed, tempo, swing plane, face angle, sequencing), diagnoses key faults, synthesizes prioritized drills and session plans, schedules practice reminders, and tracks KPI-driven progress toward handicap reduction. The system uses automated reasoning and planning to propose week-by-week routines and dynamically adapts plans based on performance; a human coach review loop is included for final validation and safety/explainability of instruction.
input_requirements: high-quality swing video (front/face/backswing/down-the-line recommended, mp4/slow-motion when available)
optional IMU/accelerometer/gyroscope data from wearable or club sensor (CSV/JSON via API)
optional club/shot-tracking data (ball speed, spin, launch angle) via provider APIs
user profile: current handicap, goals, physical constraints, practice availability
tech_stack: MediaPipe or OpenPose (pose estimation / keypoint extraction)
React Native or Flutter (mobile app for uploads and drills)
S3 or equivalent object storage (video/audio artifacts)
MLflow or Weights & Biases (model lifecycle & experiments)
Jupyter / Label-studio (data labeling and annotation tooling)

banned_tools: Avoid closed-source, non-explainable 'black-box' coaching APIs with no model interpretability
Avoid collecting unnecessary PII and avoid storing raw videos longer than needed without consent
Avoid using unvetted third-party models for medical/physical advice without expert review
required_integrations: Calendar integration (Google Calendar / iCal) for scheduling practice sessions
Optional club/sensor APIs (TrackMan, Arccos, Garmin) where available
compliance_requirements: gdpr (data subject rights, data minimization, retention policies)
age restrictions / COPPA considerations if minors are users

effort_breakdown: MVP: 6-8 weeks (video upload + pose pipeline, simple rule-based diagnostics, basic practice-plan generator, mobile/web upload UI, progress dashboard). Full implementation: 3+ months (robust ML models for metric extraction, sensor/API integrations, real-time feedback, coach dashboard, scaling, continuous learning pipeline).
llm_insights: Reliable pose and club-tracking from variable-quality consumer video (lighting, occlusion, camera angle)
Labeling and ground-truthing of swing faults and outcomes at scale (requires coach-annotated dataset)
Translating technical diagnostics into safe, personalized drills that reduce risk of injury
Model explainability and user trust for actionable coaching advice
Latency and accuracy trade-offs for real-time feedback vs batch analysis
llm_challenges: Reliable pose and club-tracking from variable-quality consumer video (lighting, occlusion, camera angle)
Labeling and ground-truthing of swing faults and outcomes at scale (requires coach-annotated dataset)
Translating technical diagnostics into safe, personalized drills that reduce risk of injury
Model explainability and user trust for actionable coaching advice
Latency and accuracy trade-offs for real-time feedback vs batch analysis
llm_recommended_approach: 1) Discovery & data collection: define required outputs (metrics that correlate to handicap reduction: clubhead speed, ball launch, dispersion, tempo, attack angle). Collect initial dataset: volunteer users + coach annotated swings and any available sensor data. 2) MVP pipeline: implement video ingestion, keypoint extraction (MediaPipe/OpenPose), derive heuristic metrics (joint angles, sequencing, tempo). Build rule-based diagnostic engine to map metric thresholds to prioritized drills. Expose APIs and a simple mobile/web uploader and dashboard. 3) Human-in-loop: include coach review UI so a certified coach can accept/adjust automated diagnoses and drill plans (required to prevent poor advice). Mark feasibility as Partially Automatable due to coach oversight. 4) ML iteration: train supervised models to predict swing faults and ball outcomes from pose + sensor features; add personalization layer that models user improvement curves and adapt plans. 5) Feedback & planning: implement an agentic planner that reasons over user schedule, fatigue, and progress to generate weekly practice plans and micro-goals; allow user overrides. 6) Integrations: add optional sensor/club provider APIs (Arccos, TrackMan, Garmin), calendar and push notifications for reminders. 7) Monitoring & continuous learning: capture outcomes after drills, retrain models periodically, maintain audit logs and model explainability for each recommendation. 8) Deployment & safety: enforce consent, store PII encrypted, surface uncertainty/confidence with each automated recommendation and require coach sign-off for high-risk changes. Start with on_demand batch analysis; roadmap to optional real-time feedback via WebRTC.
